project.name: Behavioral Adversary Modeling System - BAMS
project.description:
This project models an automated system intended to aid computer network administrators in analyzing the vulnerabilities of their systems against various kinds of potential attackers. In our Behavioral Adversary Modeling System (BAMS), the security analyst selects the attributes and objectives of a potential adversary and then invokes a Course Of Action (COA) generator to hypothesize attacks that such an adversary is likely to choose in attempting to subvert the system. The analyst can then use this information to evaluate the susceptibility of his system to attacks by a particular type of adversary, and to select the most reasonable defensive measures. This project was based on the work of M. Boddy and H. Shackleton which was motivated by a particularly challenging problem: analyzing the threat posed by malicious insiders, adversaries who are legitimate users of the system, with the ability to mount physical, cyber, and social engineering exploits to achieve their goals. Our BAMS prototype generates hypothetical insider attacks against a simple but realistic model of a web-based Document Management System. BAMS can be used to generate a sequence of attacks against a given network, exploiting different vulnerabilities as old ones are blocked through configuration changes. The plans generated vary from twenty to fifty atomic steps, and are produced rapidly enough (typically less than a second) to make the interactive use of the tool feasible. The domain description was based on the document found in http://andorfer.cs.uni-dortmund.de/~edelkamp/ickeps/BAMS_domain_desc_final.pdf.

attribute.name: viewing_email
attribute.description: Process on host is viewing email.

attribute.name: scaned_host
attribute.description: Host is under protection of a virus scanner.

attribute.name: nes_admin_pwd
attribute.description: Password is a password to access the NES admin server Host.

attribute.name: viewing_doc
attribute.description: Host is viewing Doc with Process.

attribute.name: is_sniffed
attribute.description: Host is running packet sniffer Sp.

attribute.name: reachable_fw
attribute.description: Host1 can reach Host2 going trough firewall.

attribute.name: euid
attribute.description: Process is running on Host as Uid.

attribute.name: fstype
attribute.description: Host has file system type Fstype.

attribute.name: host_locked
attribute.description: Host is locked.

attribute.name: running_prog
attribute.description: Host is running program Executable with process id Process.

operator.name: download_file_injector
operator.constraints:
pre: Human.insider = true and Human.at_host = Host and Uid.authenticated = Host and File.empty_file = true and (Uid.file_write->includes(File) or Gid.file_write->includes(File)) and not(Human.tech_skill = low_skill)
post: File.file_contents_program = File.file_contents_program->including(Prog)

operator.name: write_new_file_injector
operator.constraints:
pre: Human.insider = true and Human.at_host = Host and Uid.authenticated = Host and Prog.unwritten_code = true and File.empty_file = true and (Uid.file_write->includes(File) or Gid.file_write->includes(File)) and Human.tech_skill = high_skill
post: File.file_contents_program = File.file_contents_program->including(Prog)

operator.name: inject_code
operator.constraints:
pre: Human.at_host = Chost and Chost.running_prog(Cproc) = Code and Shost.running_prog(Sproc) = Sprog and Cprog.can_inject(Code) = Sprog and Chost.reachable.includes(Shost)
post: Shost.running_prog(Sproc) = Code

operator.name: relay_viewed_doc
operator.constraints:
pre: Human.at_host = Dst_host and Src_host.viewing_doc(S_proc) = Doc and Src_host.running_prog(Src_proc) = Malware and Malware.can_transmit_documents = true and Dst_host.running_prog(Dst_proc) = Controller and Controller.can_receive_documents = true and Src_host.reachable->includes(Dst_host)
post: Dst_host.viewing_doc(S_proc) = Doc

operator.name: start_sniffing
operator.constraints:
pre: Program.can_sniff_packets = true and Host.running_prog(Process) = Program
post: Host.is_sniffed = Program

operator.name: PROC_FORK
operator.description:
Fork child process.
Modes: m_free m_wait_fork

attribute.name: insider
attribute.description: Human is a treacherous insider.

attribute.name: duped
attribute.description: Human has been fooled into doing something.

attribute.name: paranoid
attribute.description: Human is paranoid about security.

attribute.name: requires_signatures
attribute.description: Human only trusts in email that is digitally signed.

attribute.name: my_session
attribute.description: Human can start DMS_session.

attribute.name: dms_admin
attribute.description: Human is a DMS admin.

attribute.name: trust
attribute.description: Human currently trusts everybody in the room.

attribute.name: trusts_in_room
attribute.description: Human Truster trusts human Trusted to be in Room.

attribute.name: console_user
attribute.description: Human announced user Uid to the console at Host.

attribute.name: has_uid
attribute.description: Human has been officially assigned Uid.

attribute.name: norun
attribute.description: Human will not run File.

attribute.name: trusts_host
attribute.description: Human will type at Host.

attribute.name: tech_skill
attribute.description: Human has skill level tech skills.

attribute.name: social_skill
attribute.description: Human has skill level social skills.

operator.name: CHECK_EMAIL_ENCLOSURE
operator.description: Person checks the enclosure of Email aparently from Author.

operator.name: DONE_WRITE
operator.description: The body of Email from Human is completed.

operator.name: READ_DOC
operator.constraints:
pre: Human.in_room = Room and Host.in_room = Room and Host.host_locked = false and Host.viewing_doc(Proc) = Doc and Doc.file_contents_info->includes(Info)
post: Human.knows = Human.knows->including(Info)

operator.name: NES_ADMIN_LOGIN
operator.constraints:
pre: Admin.at_host = Chost and -- Duvida da precondicao The client host is running the client process, sera que e has_process Chost.running_prog(Cproc) = Cprog and Cprogt.can_access_dms = true and -- Duvida da precondicao The server host is running the server process, sera que e has_process Sprog.running_prog(Sproc) = Sprog and Sprog.nes_admin_prog = true and Human.knows->includes(Pwd) and Shost.nes_admin_pwd = Pwd and Chost.nd_connected = Nd and Chost.reachable->includes(Shost) and c_firewall.allInstances()->forall(f | if (Chost.reachable_fw(Shost) = f) then f.fw_allows_nesadmin = true endif)
post: Chost.nes_admin_connected = Chost.nes_admin_connected->including(Shost) and Chost.is_keylogged->forall(k: c_keylogger| k.keylogger_contents = k.keylogger_contents->including(Pwd)) and --Duvida na representacao do efeito Any packet sniffers on the hub/switch try to sniff the password info Sp.sniffer_contents->includes(Info)

operator.name: DMS_PWD_CHANGE
operator.constraints:
pre: Chost.nes_admin_connected->includes(Shost) and Admin.at_host = Chost and Admin.insider = true and Uid.dms_password(Shost) = Pwd
post: Admin.knows = Admin.knows->including(Pwd) and c_human.allInstances().forall(p | p.knows = p.knows->excluding(PWD)) and detection_risk =detection_risk + 10

operator.name: DMS_ADD_GROUP_ALLOW
operator.constraints:
pre: Chost.nes_admin_connected->includes(Shost) and Admin.at_host = Chost and Admin.insider = true
post: Doc.dmsacl_read = Doc.dmsacl_read->including(Gid)

operator.name: read_sniffer
operator.constraints:
pre: Sp.sniffer_contents->includes(Info) and Human.at_host = Host and Host.running_prog(Process) = Sp and Sp.can_sniff_packets
post: Human.knows = Human.knows->including(Info)

operator.name: LOCK_SCREEN
operator.constraints:
pre: Host.host_locked = false and Human.at_host and Uid.authenticated = Host
post: Host.host_locked = true

operator.name: UNLOCK_SCREEN
operator.constraints:
pre: Host.host_locked = true and Human.at_host = Host and Human.trust = true and Uid.authenticated = Host and Human.knows->includes(Info) and Uid.login_password(Host) = Info
post: Host.host_locked = false

operator.name: DO_FILE_UPDATE
operator.constraints:
pre: Human.knows_instruction->includes(Instruction) and Human.trusts_instruction->includes(Instruction) and Instruction.inst_to = Human and Instruction.inst_update_file(Host) = File and Human.at_host = Host and Uid.authenticated = Host and Human.has_uid = Uid and Host.has_process->excludes(Process) and -- The file is executable -- The file is accessible from the host. -- The uid is a member in the gid. -- The file gives exec permission to the uid or the gid. File.accessible = Host and Uid.in_group->includes(Gid) and (File.file_exec->includes(Uid) or File.file_exec->includes(Gid))
post: -- Duvida, como representar The file update is executed??

operator.name: INSTRUCT_FILE_UPDATE
operator.constraints:
pre: Writer.insider = true and Instructio.inst_by = null and
post: Instruction.inst_by = Human and Writer.knows_instruction = Writer.knows_instruction->including(Instruction) and Instruction.inst_update_file(Host) = File

attribute.name: encrypted
attribute.description: Info is encrypted and decryptable by key Ekey.

attribute.name: weak_password
attribute.description: Password is weak. - eg. dictionary word.

attribute.name: inst_update_file
attribute.description: Instruction tells to update File on Host.

attribute.name: inst_by
attribute.description: Instruction is given by Human.

attribute.name: inst_to
attribute.description: Instruction is for Human.

class.name: c_file
class.description: A file which contains one or more programs

attribute.name: file_encrypted
attribute.description: File is encrypted and decryptable by key Ekey.

attribute.name: accessible
attribute.description: File is on a mounted drive or otherwise accessible by Host.

attribute.name: empty_file
attribute.description: File is empty.

attribute.name: file_owner
attribute.description: File is owned by principal ID.

attribute.name: file_group
attribute.description: File is assigned to unix group Gid.

attribute.name: login_shell
attribute.description: File contains a login shell.

class.name: c_email
class.description: An email message, possibly with attachments

attribute.name: transmitted
attribute.description: Email has been sent.

attribute.name: apparent_sender
attribute.description: Email seems to be sent by Human.

attribute.name: will_open_attachment
attribute.description: Email will open on Host.

attribute.name: signed
attribute.description: Email is digitally signed by key Ekey.

attribute.name: can_compose_email
attribute.description: Program can compose email.

attribute.name: can_read_email
attribute.description: Program is an email reader.

attribute.name: can_transfer_email
attribute.description: Program is a email transfer APP.

attribute.name: file_infector
attribute.description: Malware can infect files with it self.

attribute.name: can_infect
attribute.description: File Prog can be infected by Malware.

attribute.name: can_transmit_documents
attribute.description: Trojan Program can transmit documents from programs it infects.

attribute.name: can_receive_documents
attribute.description: Trojan Program can receive documents from trojan transmitters.

attribute.name: code_injector
attribute.description: Program is a code injector.

attribute.name: can_inject
attribute.description: Vic can have Code injected by Att (c_program).

attribute.name: known_virus
attribute.description: Program has a known viral signature.

attribute.name: virus_scanner
attribute.description: Program is a virus scanner.

attribute.name: can_access_dms
attribute.description: Program can be a dms client.

attribute.name: can_serve_dms_docs
attribute.description: Program can be a dms server.

attribute.name: nes_admin_prog
attribute.description: Program can be a NES admin server.

attribute.name: can_sniff_packets
attribute.description: Program can sniff packets.

attribute.name: can_exec_programs
attribute.description: Program can execute new programs.

attribute.name: unwritten_code
attribute.description: Program has yet to be written.

attribute.name: dms_password
attribute.description: Password is a DMS password for Uid on host Server.

attribute.name: authenticated
attribute.description: Uid has been authenticated on console Host.

attribute.name: login_password
attribute.description: Info can be used as a password for Uid on Host.

attribute.name: wtmp
attribute.description: Audit log of Host contains login for user Uid.

operator.name: OPEN_EMAIL_ENCLOSURE
operator.description: Ruid opens email enclosure of Email containing Attachment.

operator.name: VIEW_EMAIL
operator.constraints:
pre: Email.in_inbox->includes(Ruid) and Host.running_prog(Mua_proc) = Mua_prog and Host.euid(Mua_proc) = Ruid and Human.at_host = Host and Email.apparent_sender = Author and Human.requires_signatures = false
post: Host.viewing_email(Mua_proc) = Email and Email.email_contents->forAll(info: c_info| Human.knows = Human.knows->including(info)) and Email.email_contents_instructions->forAll(inst: c_instruction| Human.knows_instruction = Human.knows_instruction->including(inst))

operator.name: VIEW_EMAIL_SIGNED
operator.constraints:
pre: Email.in_inbox->includes(Ruid) and Host.running_prog(Mua_proc) = Mua_prog and Host.euid(Mua_proc) = Ruid and Human.at_host = Host and Email.apparent_sender = Author and Email.signed = Key and Author.has_ekey->includes(Key)
post: Host.viewing_email(Mua_proc) = Email and Email.email_contents->forAll(info: c_info| Human.knows = Human.knows->including(info)) and Email.email_contents_instructions->forAll(inst: c_instruction| Human.knows_instruction = Human.knows_instruction->including(inst))

attribute.name: dms_authenticated
attribute.description: Uid has authenticated to DMS session.

attribute.name: dms_request_in_progress
attribute.description: DMS session is making a document request.

class.name: ID
class.description: A generic ID (not specified in the original domain, added for convenience).

attribute.name: fw_allows_https

attribute.name: fw_allows_nesadmin

class.name: c_key

attribute.name: can_unlock
attribute.description: Key can unlock Lock.

attribute.name: can_lock
attribute.description: Lock can lock Door from Room.

classAssociation.name: knows

classAssociation.description: Cert is a digital certificate for Uid.

classAssociation.name: cert_installed
classAssociation.description: Cert is installed on host.

classAssociation.name: has_keylogger

classAssociation.name: keylogger_contents
classAssociation.description: Keylogger contains Info.

classAssociation.name: trusts_recipient
classAssociation.description: Human truster trusts recipient of information Trusted.

classAssociation.name: nes_admin_connected
classAssociation.description: Chost is in an admin session on Shost.

classAssociation.name: dms_requesting

classAssociation.name: dmsacl_read
classAssociation.description: Uid or Gid is allowed to write File.

classAssociation.description: Uid or Gid is allowed to list File.

classAssociation.description: Uid or Gid is allowed to info File.

classAssociation.description: Packet sniffer has sniffed Info.

classAssociation.name: reachable
classAssociation.description: Host1 can reach Host2 directly.

classAssociation.name: door
classAssociation.description: Room has a door.

classAssociation.name: has_key
classAssociation.description: Human is in possession of Key.

classAssociation.name: in_room
classAssociation.description: A physical thing is in room.

classAssociation.name: at_host
classAssociation.description: Human is at Host and ready to type.

classAssociation.name: file_read
classAssociation.description: Id can read File.

classAssociation.description: Id can write to File.

classAssociation.name: file_exec
classAssociation.description: File contains Info.

classAssociation.description: File contains Info.

classAssociation.name: file_contents_program
classAssociation.description: File contains program.

classAssociation.name: has_process
classAssociation.description: Host has the Process.

classAssociation.name: in_group
classAssociation.description: Uid is a member of group Gid.

classAssociation.name: nd_connected
classAssociation.description: Host is connected to network device Nd.

classAssociation.name: fw_connected
classAssociation.description: Firewall is connected to network device Nd.

classAssociation.name: forking
classAssociation.description: Uid has forked a new process on Host.

useCase.name: Start email
useCase.description:
The human starts sending an email at the host.
Modes: - m_free - m_email_started

definition.postcondition: - the human is writing the email on the host as the uid.

useCase.name: Set sender
useCase.description:
The human sets the legitimate sender.
Modes: - m_email_started - m_email_senderset

definition.postcondition: - the email seems to be sent by the human.

useCase.name: Change sender
useCase.description:
The drafter (actual sender) changes the email sender to a spoofed sender.
Modes: - m_email_started - m_email_senderset

definition.precondition: - the actual sender is writing the email; - the actual sender is an insider.
definition.postcondition: - the email seems to be sent by the spoofed sender.

useCase.name: Add recipient
useCase.description:
The human sender adds a recipient (human) to the email.
Modes: - m_email_senderset - m_email_senderset

definition.postcondition: - the uid is in an intended recipient of the email.

useCase.name: Write email
useCase.description:
The human write the email containing info.
Modes: - m_email_writing -m_email_writing

definition.precondition: - the human is writing the email; - the human knows the info.
definition.postcondition: - the email contains the info.

useCase.name: Write email instruction
useCase.description:
Write email containing instructions.
Modes: - m_email_writing - m_email_writing

definition.precondition: - the human is writing the email; - the email contains the instructions.
definition.postcondition: - the email contains the instructions.

useCase.name: Sign email
useCase.description:
The human signs the email.
Modes: e_email_writing m_email_attaching

definition.precondition: - the sender is writing the email; - the sender allows the use of the key for signing the email.
definition.postcondition: - the email is is digitally signed with the key.

useCase.name: Attatch to email
useCase.description:
Add attachement to the email.
Modes: - m_email_attaching - m_email_attaching

definition.postcondition: - the file is attached to the email; - the detection risk has increased by 1.

useCase.name: Send email
useCase.description:
Sends the email.
Modes: - m_email_attaching - m_free

useCase.name: Open email enclosure
useCase.description:
Ruid opens email enclosure of email containing attachment.
Modes: - m_attachement_opening - m_free

definition.precondition: - the attached file is attached to the email; - host will open attachment on email.
definition.postcondition: - if the attached file contains an unknown virus, or the host does not scan for viruses, the virus will infect every file on the host that the reader of the email as write access to.
- the process on the host is viewing the email; - the recipient learns the info/instructions in the email.
- the process on the host is viewing the email; - the recipient learns the info/instructions in the email.

useCase.name: Check email enclosure
useCase.description:
Person checks the enclusure of email aparently from author.
Modes: - m_free - m_attachment_opening

definition.postcondition: - host opens attachment from email.

useCase.name: Done recipient
useCase.description:
Email has been adressed.
Modes: - m_email_senderset - m_email_writing

definition.precondition: - Ruid is recipient of email.
definition.postcondition: None.

useCase.name: Done write
useCase.description:
The body of email from human is completed.
Modes: - m_email_writing - m_email_attaching

definition.precondition: - human is writing email.
definition.postcondition: None.

useCaseDiagram.name: Use Case Diagram - Encryption
useCaseDiagram.description: A human or piece of info can be used for authentication.

definition.postcondition: - the file and all of its info is encrypted with the key.

useCaseDiagram.name: Use Case Diagram - Keydrop
useCaseDiagram.description: A keylogger can be installed on a host. When a keylogger is installed on a host, it can recor information that is entered at the keyboard.

definition.precondition: - the keylogger contains the info; - the human has the keylogger.
definition.postcondition: - the human knows the info.
- the file now contains the injector program.
- the file now contains the injector program.
- the server host is now running the code as the server process.
- the destination host is viewing the file.

useCaseDiagram.name: Use Case Diagram - DMS
useCaseDiagram.description: A file can be read over the dms if the user has read acces to the document, or if the group has read acces to the document and the user is a member of the group.

useCase.name: Begin session
useCase.description:
Begin dms session.
Modes: m_free m_dms_sess

definition.precondition: - the dms session is not a connecting active session.
definition.postcondition: - the dms session is a connecting active session.

useCase.name: Find client
useCase.description:
Find the client.
Modes: m_dms_sess m_dms_access

useCase.name: Route
useCase.description:
Find the server.
Modes: m_dms_connect m_dms_know

definition.postcondition: - the dms session is connected to the server process; - the dms session has the server host as its server host.
- the dms session is an active connected session.
- the uid has authenticated to the dms session; - the dms session is an authenticated session.
- any keyloggers attached now know the password info; - the dms session has been authenticated with the password.

useCase.name: Authenticate
useCase.description:
Authenticate to dms.
Modes: m_dms_auth m_free

definition.postcondition: - the uid has authenticated to the dms session; - the dms session is an authenticated session.
- the dms session is making a document request.
- the file is requested from the dms session.
- the human reads th file and learns the info.
- the gid is allowed to read the file.

useCaseDiagram.name: Use Case Diagram - Network
useCaseDiagram.description: A packet sniffer can be installed on a network hub or switch, however it can only gather information off a hub. The sniffer can be used to gather passwords and information in emails. When a hub has a packet sniffer installed, all traffic from all hosts connected to the hub is sniffed.

definition.precondition: - the program can sniff packets; - the program is running on the host as the process.
definition.postcondition: - the host is running the packet sniffer.
- the human learns the info.

useCaseDiagram.name: Use Case Diagram - Physical
useCaseDiagram.description: - a key, human and host are physical things; - a person will leave a room if they trust the remaining people in the room or they are an insider.

definition.precondition: - the human and they key must be in the same room.
definition.postcondition: - the human has the key and they key is no longer in the room.

definition.precondition: - the human must have the key and be in the room; - the key is in the room and no longer in the possession of the human.

definition.postcondition: - the lock is no longer locked.
- the door is open.
- the human has moved from room 1 to room 2.
- the door is closed.
- the human is at the host.

definition.precondition: - the human is at the host.
definition.postcondition: - the human is no longer at the host.

useCaseDiagram.name: Use Case Diagram - Process

definition.precondition: - there is currently no one logged into the host.
definition.postcondition: - the uid is entered at the host.
- the process is running on the host as the uid; - all the programs in the file are running.
- the uid has forked a new process on the host.
- the uid is no longer forking a new process; - the file is executing as the uid on the host.
- the host is locked.
- the host is unlocked.
- the file update is executed.

definition.precondition: - human 1 is an insider; - the instruction is given by nobody.

state.name: m_email_senderset
state.description: Email message has sender set, adding recipients.

action.precondition: Email.transmitted = false and Host.euid(Proc) = Uid and Host.running_prog(Proc) = Prog and Human.at_host = Host and Human.my_email->includes(Email) Prog.can_compose_email = true
action.postcondition: Human.writing_email = Email and Host.writing_email = Email and Uid.writing_email = Email

action.precondition: Drafter.writing_email = Email and Drafter.insider = true
Sender.writing_email = Email and (Sender.trusts_recipient = Recip or Sender.insider = true or Recip.has_uid = Ruid)
Email.recipient = Ruid
Person.writing_email = Email and Person.knows->includes(Info)
Person.writing_email = Email and Person.knows_instruction->includes(In)
Human.writing_email = Email
Human.writing_email = Email and Ekey.authorization = Info and Human.knows->includes(Info)
Host.writing_email = Email and Suid.writing_email = Email and (File.file_read->includes(Suid) or File.file_read->includes(Gid))

Host.writing_email = Email and Human.writing_email = Email and Prog.can_transfer_email = true and Mta_host.running_prog(Mta_proc) = Prog and Host.nd_connected = Nd and Mta_host.reachable->includes(Host) and allInstance()->forAll(fw: c_firewall| if Mta_host.reachable_fw(Host) = fw then fw.fw_allows_smtp = true endif)
action.postcondition: Email.transmitted = true and Host.writing_email = null and Human.writing_email = null and Email.recipient->forAll(u: Uid| Email.in_inbox = Email.in_inbox->including(u)) and

action.precondition: Host.viewing_email(Mua_proc) and Email.apparent_sender = Author and Person.trust_enclosures->includes(Author)
Email.attached->includes(Attachment) and Email.will_open_attachment = Host
action.postcondition: -- If the attached file contains an unknown virus, or the host does not scan for viruses, the virus will infect every file on the host that the reader of the email as write access to.

action.precondition: Sess.connecting = false

Sess.connected = false and Sess.dms_established = false and Sess.connecting = true and Human.my_session = Sess and Client_host.has_process->includes(Client_proc) and Client_host.running_prog(Client_proc) = Client_prog and Client_prog.can_access_dms = true and Human.at_host = Client_host and Human.trusts_host(Client_host) = true
action.postcondition: Sess.dms_session_client = Client_host and Sess.dms_session_real_user = Human and Sess.dms_session_cproc = Client_proc

action.precondition: Ses.connected = false and Ses.dms_established = false and Server_prog.can_serve_dms_docs = true and Server_host.running_prog(server_proc) = Server_prog

Sess.dms_session_client = Client_host and Sess.dms_session_server = Server_host and Ses.connected = false and Ses.dms_established = false and Client_host.reachable = Server_host and --Any firewall in the network must allow https forwarding c_firewall.allInstances().forall(f | f.fw_allows_https = true)
Sess.dms_session_client = Chost and Sess.dms_established = false and Uid.has_cert->includes(Cert) and Chost.cert_installed->includes(Cert) and Uid.authenticated = Chost
Sess.dms_session_real_user = Human and Sess.dms_session_client = Client_host and Sess.dms_established = false and Human.knows->includes(Pwd)
action.postcondition: Client_host.is_keylogged->forall(k: c_keyloggers| k.keylogger_contents = k.keylogger_contents->including(Pwd)) and Sess.dms_session_pwd = Pwd

action.precondition: Ses.dms_established = false and Ses.connected = true and Ses.dms_session_pwd = Pwd and User.dms_password(Server_host) = Pwd
Sess.dms_established = true and Sess.dms_session_client = Chost and Human.at_host = Chost and Human.trust = true

Sess.dms_request_in_progress = true and Sess.dms_session_server = Shost and Sess.dms_authenticated = Uid and Doc.accessible = Shost and (Doc.dmsacl_read->includes(Uid) or Doc.dmsacl_read->includes(Gid))
Sess.dms_request_in_progress = true and Sess.dms_requesting->includes(Doc) and Sess.dms_session_client = Chost and Sess.dms_session_cproc = Cproc
action.postcondition: Sess.dms_request_in_progress = false and Sess.dms_requesting = Sess.dms_requesting->excluding(Doc) and Chost.viewing_doc(Cproc) = Doc

stateMachineDiagram.name: State Machine Diagram - Process
stateMachineDiagram.description: The following definitions are used in the process: - A file can contain either info or a program. - Only a program is executable. - A file is readable if the following holds: Parameters: host, file, uid, gid. - The file is accessible from the host. - The uid is a member in the gid. - The file gives read permission to the uid or the gid. - A file is writeable if the following holds: Parameters: host, file, uid, gid. - The file is accessible from the host. - The uid is a member in the gid. - The file gives write permission to the uid or the gid. - A file is executable if the following holds: Parameters: host, file, uid, gid. - The file is accessible from the host. - The uid is a member in the gid. - The file gives execute permission to the uid or the gid. - A person can log into a host if he/she trusts the host and knows the password info. - A program can execute on a host if there is no virus scanner running. - If there is a virus scanner running on the host, the program can run if it is not a virus.

action.precondition:
-- Duvida, There is currently no one logged into the host not(c_uid.allInstances().exists(user| user.authenticated = Host)) and
Human.at_host = Host and Human.trusts_host(Host) = true -- In the specification there is this precondition for logging in a host
-- Acho que e necessario a seguinte precond and Human.has_uid = Uid
Uid.authenticated <> Host and Human.console_user(Uid) = Host and Uid.login_password(Host) = Info and Human.knows->includes(info)
action.postcondition: Host.is_keylogger->forall(k: c_keylogger| k.keylogger_contents = k.keylogger_contents->including(Info)) and Uid.wtmp = Host and Uid.authenticated = Host

action.precondition: Uid.authenticated = Host and File.login_shell = true and File.accessible = Host and --Duvida Host.euid(Process) = null
action.postcondition: Host.euid(Process) = Uid and File.file_contents_program->forall(p: c_program| Host.running_prog(Process) = p) --isso nao funciona pois acredito que o atributo parametrizado deve ser unico

action.precondition: Host.has_process->includes(Process) and Host.euid(Process) = Uid and Host.running_prog(Process) = Program and Program.can_exec_programs = true

Human.at_host = Host and Human.norun(File) = false and Host.forking->includes(Uid) and --Como falar que o host no esta rodando o processo -- The file is executable -- The file is accessible from the host. -- The uid is a member in the gid. -- The file gives exec permission to the uid or the gid. File.accessible = Host and Uid.in_group->includes(Gid) and (File.file_exec->includes(Uid) or File.file_exec->includes(Gid))
action.postcondition: Host.folking->isEmpty() and -- Duvida em The file is executing as uid on the host

action.precondition: Human.at_host = Host and Uid.authenticated = Host and Uid.in_group->includes(Gid) and File.accessible = Host and (Uid.file_write->includes(File) or Gid.file_write->includes(File)) and (File.file_encrypted->isEmpty() or File.file_encrypted->exists(k: c_key| Human.has_ekey->includes(k)))
action.postcondition: File.file_encrypted = Key and File.file_contents_info->forall(info: c_info| info.encrypted = Key)

action.precondition: Human.in_room = Room and Host.in_room = Room and Human.has_keylogger->includes(Keylogger)
action.postcondition: Human.hasKeylogger = Human.hasKeylogger->excluding(Keylogger) and Host.is_keylogged = Keylogger and detection_risk = detection_risk + Room.number_of_humans

action.precondition: Human.in_room = Room and Host.in_room = Room and Host.is_keylogged->includes(Keylogger)
action.postcondition: Host.isKeylogged->isEmpty() and Human.has_keylogger = Human.has_keylogger->including(Keylogger) and detection_risk = detection_risk + Room.number_of_humans

action.precondition: Keylogger.keylogger_contents->includes(Info) and Human.has_keylogger->includes(Keylogger)
Human.in_room = Room and Key.in_room = Room
Human.has_key->includes(Key) and Human.in_room = Room
Lock.can_lock(Door) = Room and Lock.is_locked = true and Key.can_unlock = Lock and Human.has_key->includes(Key) and Human.in_room = Room
Human.in_room = Room and Room.door->includes(Door) and Door.is_open = false and c_lock.allInstances()->exists(loc | loc.can_lock(Door) = Room and loc.is_locked = false)

Human.in_room = RoomFrom and RoomFrom <> RoomTo and RoomFrom.door->includes(Door) and RoomFrom.door->includes(Door) and Door.is_open = true and Human.at_host->isEmpty() and (Human.paranoid = false or c_host.allIntances()->forall(c | if (c.in_room = RoomFrom) then c.host_locked = true endif) and (Human.insider = true or Human.trust = true)
action.postcondition: Human.in_room = RoomTo and RoomFrom.number_of_humans = RoomFrom.number_of_humans - 1 and RoomTo.number_of_humans = RoomTo.number_of_humans + 1 and

action.precondition: Human.in_room = Room and Room.door->includes(Door) and Door.is_open = true
Human.in_room = Room and Host.in_room = Room and c_human.allInstances()->forall(p | not(p.at_host = Host))
Human.at_host = Host
